entry.title: A script to install chromedriver on linux
entry.content:
Installing chromedriver on linux can be annoying. Here’s a script that takes the pain out of installing the latest (at time of writing!) 64 bit version of the driver:

```sh

!/bin/bash

wget https://chromedriver.googlecode.com/files/chromedriver_linux64_2.3.zip unzip chromedriver_linux64_2.3.zip sudo cp chromedriver /usr/bin/chromedriver sudo chown root /usr/bin/chromedriver sudo chmod +x /usr/bin/chromedriver sudo chmod 755 /usr/bin/chromedriver ```

I’ve tested it on Fedora 19.

If you need a different version of the driver, just change the link on the first line of the script.

Hope that helps!
